p: S. lavandulaefolia EO given orally once daily for 5 days to rats decreased striatal AChE activity at a lower tested dose (20 μL) and striatal and hippocampal AChE activity at a higher tested dose (50 μL); at both doses, there was no change in the AChE activity in the cortex. Temel et al. [ 37] and Bahadori et al. [ 40] demonstrated also the neuroprotective ability of S. hydrangea, S. divaricata, and S. nemorosa. In comparison to S. divaricata and S. nemorosa, the specie S. hydrangea was more efficient against AChE (IC 50 of 64.68, 434.1, and 40.0, mg/L, respectively).
